    • Field Detail

      • version

        public static final String version
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • VERBOSE

        public static boolean VERBOSE
        If VERBOSE is true, the client will print lots of messages about what it is doing. Set with debug=true; in your XML file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TCPClient

        public TCPClient(processing.core.PApplet _p,
         String _fileString)
        Client is constructed with an init file location, and the parent PApplet. The parent PApplet must have a method called "frameEvent(Client c)". The frameEvent handles syncing up the frame rate on the multiple screens and should be implemented like draw().

      • TCPClient

        public TCPClient(processing.core.PApplet _p,
         String _fileString,
         boolean _autoMode)

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Called automatically by PApplet.draw() when using auto mode.

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Returns:
        the server port

      • getID

        public int getID()
        Returns:
        the client ID

      • setLocalDimensions

        public void setLocalDimensions(int _xOffset,
                      int _yOffset,
                      int _lWidth,
                      int _lHeight)
        Sets the dimensions for the local display. The offsets are used to determine what part of the Master Dimensions to render. For example, if you have two screens, each 100x100, and the master dimensions are 200x100 then you would set client 0: setLocalDimensions(0, 0, 100, 100); client 1: setLocalDimensions(100, 0, 100, 100); for a 10 pixel overlap you would do: client 0: setLocalDimensions(0, 0, 110, 100); client 1: setLocalDimensions(90, 0, 110, 100);
        Parameters:
        _xOffset - Offsets the display along x axis
        _yOffset - Offsets the display along y axis
        _lWidth - The local width
        _lHeight - The local height

      • setMasterDimensions

        public void setMasterDimensions(int _mWidth,
                       int _mHeight)
        Sets the master dimensions for the Video Wall. This is used to calculate what is rendered.
        Parameters:
        _mWidth - The master width
        _mHeight - he master height

      • getLWidth

        public int getLWidth()
        Returns:
        the local width in pixels

      • setFieldOfView

        public void setFieldOfView(float val)
        Sets the field of view of the camera when rendering in 3D. Note that this has no effect when rendering in 2D.
        Parameters:
        val - the value of the field of view

      • getFieldOfView

        public float getFieldOfView()
        Returns:
        the value of the field of view

      • placeScreen

        public void placeScreen()
        Places the viewing area for this screen. This must be called at the beginning of the render loop. If you are using Processing, you would typically place it at the beginning of your draw() function.

      • enable3D

        public void enable3D(boolean b)
        If you want to enable or disable 3D manually in automode

      • placeScreen2D

        public void placeScreen2D()
        Places the viewing area for this screen when rendering in 2D.

      • placeScreen3D

        public void placeScreen3D()
        Places the viewing area for this screen when rendering in 3D.

      • restoreCamera

        public void restoreCamera()
        Restores the viewing area for this screen when rendering in 3D.

        Checks whether the given rectangle is on screen.

      • start

        public void start()
        This method must be called when the client PApplet starts up. It will tell the server it is ready.
        Overrides:
        start in class Thread

      • run

        public void run()
        This method should only be called internally by Thread.start().
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class Thread

      • broadcast

        public void broadcast(String msg)
        Format a broadcast message and send it. Do not use a colon '|' in your message!!!
        Parameters:
        _msg - the message to broadcast

      • messageAvailable

        public boolean messageAvailable()
        Returns true of false based on whether a String message is available from the server. This should be used inside "frameEvent()" since messages are tied to specific frames.
        Returns:
        true if a new String message is available

      • getDataMessage

        public String[] getDataMessage()
        Returns an array of messages from the server. This should be used inside "frameEvent()" since messages are tied to specific frames. It also should only be called after checking that messageAvailable() returns true.
        Returns:
        an array of messages from the server

      • getRawMessage

        public String getRawMessage()

      • done

        public void done()
        Sends a "Done" command to the server. This must be called at the end of the draw loop.

      • togglePause

        public void togglePause()

      • quit

        public void quit()
        Stops the client thread. You don't really need to do this ever.

      • isAsynchronous

        public boolean isAsynchronous()

      • isReceiver

        public boolean isReceiver()
